comment.body: Actually, I think it should return a double. I'm not sure what I was thinking the other day.

pull_request.title: Calculate CO₂ emissions of itineraries
pull_request.body:
### Summary

- CO2 emissions information required for public transport itineraries and car journeys.
- The data is loaded from a file called emissions.txt located in the gtfs package and saved to the graph during the build phase. A filter adds the emissions data to the itineraries using a service when itineraries are searched.
### Issue

closes #4940

### Unit tests

Tests added in a new file EmissionsServiceTest.java
Tests for:
1. Getting results for itinerary that has emissions data (non zero)
2. Getting results for itinerary that has zero emissions in the data
3. Not getting emission results for a feed that does not have emissions data
4. Getting results for a car journey
- Manual testing was also performed.

### Documentation

Modified:
- BuildConfiguration.md
- Configuration.md
Added:
- DigitransitEmissions.md

### Changelog

From title

milestone.description: The next release will be in March 2024.

pull_request.title: Add stricter validation for flex areas
pull_request.body:
### Summary

Currently the graph builder ignores some types of geometry errors when importing NeTEx flex data.
In particular self-intersecting polygons are imported without any validation error:
![image](https://github.com/opentripplanner/OpenTripPlanner/assets/46598384/49063f44-0238-4562-b620-e6a1091d7270)


This PR applies a stricter validation when parsing polygons so that invalid areas are rejected (i.e. ignored)  during graph building.

### Issue

No

### Unit tests

Added unit test

### Documentation
No

issue.title: Routing car past highway crossing
issue.body:
## Expected behavior
Routing past highway crossing should be allowed

## Observed behavior
When trying to route past highway crossing with mode=car, no trips are returned

## Version of OTP used (exact commit hash or JAR name)
23fe6893eea761005cdfaa9a9c1831c4c0ec0010

## Data sets in use (links to GTFS and OSM PBF files)

## Command line used to start OTP
java -Xmx6G -jar target\otp-2.4.0-SNAPSHOT-shaded.jar --load c:\Downloads\OTPData

## Router config and graph build config JSON

## Steps to reproduce the problem
Search trip past node https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/370805516#map=18/55.71854/13.19627

Searching on either side of crossing is ok
![image](https://github.com/opentripplanner/OpenTripPlanner/assets/146102600/3a337197-9f0e-4bbf-970d-2d6db8d32109)

Search with mode=bike is ok
![image](https://github.com/opentripplanner/OpenTripPlanner/assets/146102600/2434926f-ab28-4673-a05f-25e95ead635e)

Search with mode=car spanning the crossing returns no trips
![image](https://github.com/opentripplanner/OpenTripPlanner/assets/146102600/640d0538-0292-404d-8a20-76d3b8224f6d)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -142,7 +142,7 @@ local machine. It can be informative to watch the HTTP requests and responses be
 the developer tools in your web browser. OTP's built-in web server will run by default on ports 8080
 and 8081 for HTTP and HTTPS respectively. If by any chance some other software is already using one
 or both of those port numbers, you can specify different port numbers with switches
-like `--port 8801 --securePort 8802`.
+like `--port 8801`.

pull_request.title: Add support for DSJ in transit leg reference
pull_request.body:
### Summary
As detailed in #5422, a transit leg reference should refer to a TripOnServiceDate id (i.e. dated service journey id) when one exists,
since a dated service journey provides a more stable id across deliveries of planned data.

The PR introduces also a builder for ScheduledTransitLeg and FrequencyTransitLeg.

### Issue


Closes #5422

### Unit tests

Added unit tests

### Documentation

No

repo.description: An open source multi-modal trip planner

issue.title: Add support for DSJ in transit leg reference
issue.body:
### Summary
As detailed in #5422, a transit leg reference should refer to a TripOnServiceDate id (i.e. dated service journey id) when one exists,
since a dated service journey provides a more stable id across deliveries of planned data.

The PR introduces also a builder for ScheduledTransitLeg and FrequencyTransitLeg.

### Issue


Closes #5422

### Unit tests

Added unit tests

### Documentation

No

comment.body:
This implementation guarantees backward compatibility (newer versions of OTP can parse tokens generated by previous versions of OTP), but not forward compatibility (an older version of OTP would fail when attempting to deserialize a token generated by a newer version). This is due to the deserializer attempting to resolve the token version as a Java enum, which is missing in older versions of the class.
This issue may arise when running a rolling update in a cloud environment, where both the old and new version of OTP are running simultaneously during a short period.
However, while testing in a production-like environment, the error did not occur: leg references are most likely used over longer periods than a typical rollout time.

The conclusion is that:
- forward compatibility is a minor, non-blocking issue in regard to the more serious consistency issues that this PR intends to fix.
- the versioning mechanism should be revisited as suggested in #5451

pull_request.title: Make vehicleRentalStation query optionally accept id without feed

### Documentation
